project.teaser: The QuantiFarm project focusses on supporting the further deployment of digital technologies in agriculture (DATs) as key enablers for enhancing the sustainability (economic, environmental, social) performance and competitiveness of the agricultural sector. It will achieve...
project.objective: The QuantiFarm project focusses on supporting the further deployment of digital technologies in agriculture (DATs) as key enablers for enhancing the sustainability (economic, environmental, social) performance and competitiveness of the agricultural sector. It will achieve this by establishing a framework for assessing the impact and effectiveness of DATs in agriculture and developing innovative tools, services and recommendations for farmers, advisors and policy makers. Following a multi-actor approach, QuantiFarm will build the project activities around 30 Test Cases (TCs) which span over 20 countries in 10 (of the 11) Biogeographical regions across Europe, capturing multiple geo-political and financial settings. All 30 TCs take place in commercial farms of different types, sizes, ownership and operating conditions from 7 agricultural sectors. Different aspects of these TCs will be examined in the context of different work packages (WPs). The TCs’ actors will be engaged in participatory observation activities to offer valuable input and actively support the behavioural analysis (WP1), the establishment of the Assessment Framework (WP2) and the co-design of an innovative Toolkit for farmers, advisors and policy makers (WP3). The lean multi-actor approach will be used in the testing activities to evaluate the QuantiFarm Toolkit and validate the Assessment Framework by testing the various DATs in real life conditions, across 3 iterations/growing seasons (WP4). The outcomes will be transformed into policy recommendations (WP5) and will feed the QuantiFarm DIA that will help build the capacities of farmers’ advisors in DATs. Finally, a WP on dissemination, ecosystem building and exploitation (WP6), will guarantee the wider dissemination and knowledge transfer in a multi-actor context of the outputs of the project. QuantiFarm includes 32 partners, 12 of them representing farmers and advisors.
project.title: Assessing the impact of digital technology solutions in agriculture in real-life conditions
project.keywords: Digital Agriculture Technologies, Assessment Framework, Innovative Advisory Services, Digital Tools, Sustainability Assessment, Cost-Benefit Analysis, Independent Monitoring, CAP, Decision support

article.title: Testing a high-tech generation of digital agriculture solutions

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - QuantiFarm (Assessing the impact of digital technology solutions in agriculture in real-life conditions)
result.teaser: The last decade has seen an explosion of interest and investment in the use of digital technologies in agriculture and food production. These initiatives have come under the label of “precision agriculture”, “smart farming” and more generally digital agriculture...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Tools for DATs Assessment and Policy Monitoring - initial version
result.description: Technical specifications and implementation of reusable tools for DATs assessment and policy monitoring

result.title: Test Case evaluation report for reporting period 2
result.description: The second annual periodic report on monitoring and evaluation outcomes of each TC during the second year of testing, including lessons learnt

result.title: QuantiFarm DIA - updated version
result.description: The updated version of the report presenting the QuantiFarm DIA with updated content and activities

result.title: Third Dissemination, Exploitation & Communication Plan
result.description: A report presenting the updated version of the DEC plan and the relevant activities that took place during this period.

result.title: Benefits and Cost Calculators - initial version
result.description: A report on DATs on selected farming systems and their economic and environmental benefits and costs. To be updated based on results from the TCs

result.title: Assessment Framework and Governance Mechanisms - first updated version
result.description: A new version of the report presenting the Assessment Framework and the Governance Mechanisms for Independent Evaluation, including guidelines on how to use them. Updated to incorporate lessons learnt from the 1st round of testing activities.

result.title: Behavioural Determinants for DAT Adoption - first version
result.description: Report on the analyses conducted (desk study; survey, observations and workshops) and related storyboards.

result.title: Second Dissemination, Exploitation & Communication Plan
result.description: A report presenting the updated version of the DEC plan and the relevant activities that took place during this period.

result.title: QuantiFarm DIA - initial version
result.description: A report presenting the DIA, its mechanisms and the training material.

result.title: Test Case evaluation report for reporting period 1
result.description: The first annual periodic report on monitoring and evaluation outcomes of each TC during the first year of testing, including lessons learnt

result.title: Data Requirements and Interoperability - final version
result.description: Final version of the technical specs and implementation of the data collection and harmonisation mechanisms, updated to include the new sources.

result.title: QuantiFarm Toolkit - initial version
result.description: Technical specification and implementation of the QuantiFarm Toolkit as a user friendly web platform

result.title: Behavioural Determinants for DAT Adoption - final version
result.description: Τhe final version of the report with the updated version of the storyboards. It also includes applicable guidelines to incorporate behavioural aspects in Toolkit, the DIA and the advisory services.

result.title: First Dissemination, Exploitation & Communication Plan
result.description: A report presenting the DEC plan, with guidelines for partners & an action plan on synergies with other initiatives.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
